name: sscond
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)), wss(c2, c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wss(c2, c1))
-| wi(wss(c2, c1), wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wss(c2, c1))
-| wi(wss(c2, c1), wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)))

body.origin: |- wi(wss(c2, c1), wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wss(cdif(c0, c1), cdif(c0, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wss(c2, c1))

comment: If ` A ` is contained in ` B ` , then ` ( C \ B ) ` is contained in ` ( C \ A ) ` . Deduction form of ~ sscon . (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
